critique: The document is a formal executive order regarding the implementation of the Convention on the International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972. It is primarily concerned with legal and administrative procedures, assigning responsibilities to the Secretary of the Navy and the Secretary of the Department in which the Coast Guard is operating. The language is formal and technical, with no indication of emotions such as joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. Therefore, all emotions should be scored as 1.
